page.title: 15Shipton C/E Primary School
page.content: {Shipton School}was built by the Dawnay Family of Beningbrough Hall,in 1854.It is situated in the middle of Shipton, and is a Victorian building.There are 64 pupils in the school aged between 5 yrs and 11 yrs.There are 3 full time teachers and 1 part time teacher.A cook and 2 kitchen assistants,a caretaker,a part time secretary and a lolly pop lady who helps children cross the A19.There are three classes, an infant class,a lower junior class and an upper junior class.Over the years the school has had many changes for example a false ceiling has been put in to make the school warmer,a canteen has been built on,electric storage heaters have replaced open fires.One large room has been divided into two classrooms and a temporary classroom has been put on the field. Shipton School will close in July 1986
